Evans.description: A model trained on a corpus of printed books, pamphlets, and broadsides from the Evans Early American Imprint Collection, transcribed by the Text Creation Partnership and regularized by the Visualizing Early Print project. The corpus contains 101,787,912 words in 5,012 texts.

DocSouth.description: A model trained on a corpus of of books and articles that document the individual and collective stories of African Americans in the eighteenth–early twentieth century in the United States. It is part of the Documenting the American South Project from the University of North Carolina. The corpus contains 11,376,694 words in 294 texts.

Wright.description: A model trained on a corpus of eighteenth- and nineteenth-century American fiction from the Wright American Fiction project. The corpus contains 234,607,442 words in 2,876 texts.

ECCO.description: A model trained on the standardized version of the Eighteenth Century Collections Online corpus published by the Visualizing Early Print project. The corpus contains 74,556,712 words in 2,473 texts.

EEBO.description: A model trained on the “Early Modern 1080” corpus published by the Visualizing Early Print project; this corpus includes 40 randomly-selected texts per decade from the Early English Books Online–Text Creation Partnership collection. The corpus contains 37,614,609 words in 1,080 texts.

WWO Corpus.description: A model trained on the entire Women Writers Online corpus of women's writing from 1526 to 1850. This corpus contains 10,978,553 words in 415 texts.

VWWP and WWO.shortDescription: The Victorian Women Writers Project and Women Writers Online Combined Corpus
VWWP and WWO.description: A model trained on a combined corpus that includes all texts from both the Victorian Women Writers Project and Women Writers Online. This corpus contains 19,044,358 words in 614 texts.

Experimental no names.description: An experimental model trained on a dataset of texts from Women Writers Online in which names have been removed.

Experimental tiny.description: An experimental model trained on a corpus of several novels from WWO, comprising approximately 500K words.

Experimental no prep.description: An experimental model trained on a dataset of texts from Women Writers Online that has been minimally processed.

Experimental win 2.description: An experimental model trained on the texts in Women Writers Online, using a window size of 2 in the model training process.

Experimental dim 100.description: An experimental model trained on the texts in Women Writers Online, using 100 dimensions in the model training process

Agostini.description: A model trained on a corpus of early Italian scientific, medical, and autobiographical essays and manuscripts. The corpus contains 1,039,821 words in 12 texts.

Champagne.description: A model trained on a corpus of documents collected under the query "Native American literature" from the Internet Archive, including educational, creative, and non-fiction works. The corpus contains 9,019,229 words in 337 texts.

Clawson.description: A model trained on a corpus of prominent nineteenth and early-twentieth century novels from a variety of British and American authors. The corpus contains 76,112,439 words in 737 texts.

Cloutier.description: A model trained on a corpus of documents from the Foreign Relations of the United States (FRUS) collection. This corpus contains 10,100,862 words in 23 texts.

Joyce.description: A model trained on a corpus of comments, transcripts, and interviews regarding Wikipedia deliberations. The corpus contains 1,540,558 words in 3,357 texts.

Kuliyeva.description: A model trained on a corpus of Shakespeare's dramatic works from the Folger Digital Editions collection, including histories, tragedies, romances, and comedies. The corpus contains 885,010 words in 37 texts.

Loewen.description: A model trained on a corpus of the archived journal articles and reviews from the International Journal for Philosophy of Religion. The corpus contains 39,010,832 words in 17,073 texts.

Mapp.description: A model trained on a corpus of women's biographies from the Collective Biographies of Women project at UVA. The corpus contains 1,697,467 words in 430 texts.

Peljak-Łapińska1.description: A model trained on a corpus of twenty- and twenty-first century short stories and popular Anglophone fiction. The corpus contains 3,506,248 words in 876 texts.

Peljak-Łapińska2.description: A model trained on a corpus of twenty- and twenty-first century short stories and popular Anglophone fiction translated into Belarusian. The corpus contains 2,751,250 words in 880 texts.

Rodrigues.description: A model trained on a corpus of autobiographies and biographies from the early twentieth century, including narratives from immigrants in the US. The corpus contains 3,857,658 words in 42 texts.

Rust.description: A model trained on a corpus of EAD finding aids from Northeastern University's Archives and Special Collections. The corpus contains 1,191,319 words in 331 texts.

Standard.description: A model trained on a corpus of autobiographical and fiction writing by women in the United States collected from Documenting the American South, the Wright American fiction project, and Project Gutenberg. The corpus contains 23,279,229 words in 246 texts.

VandeCreek.description: A model trained on a corpus of transcripts from policy debates in Congress from 1873 to 1896. The corpus contains approximately 165,000,000 words.

Wilson-Saia.description: A model trained on a corpus of Jane Austen's fictional writing and letters, incuding her juvenille writings and those published posthumously. The corpus contians 1,049,337 words in 10 texts.

Johnson.description: A model trained on a corpus of finding aids for LGBT collections (using ArchiveGrid) from One Archive (LA), the GLBT Historical Society, Cornell University, and the New York Public Library. The corpus contains 1,602,200 words in 304 texts.

Connell.description: A model trained on a corpus of histories from the Early English Books Online–Text Creation Partnership. The corpus contains 10,929,084 words in 52 texts.

TCP1.description: Currently displayed: a subset of texts from the Text Creation Partnership that contains approximately the same number of words as the full Women Writers Online corpus, to allow for experimental comparisons between the two corpora. This is one of several TCP corpora, each of which has a different selection of texts. This corpus contains 8,329,588 words in 205 texts.

TCP2.description: Currently displayed: a subset of texts from the Text Creation Partnership that contains approximately the same number of words as the full Women Writers Online corpus, to allow for experimental comparisons between the two corpora. This is one of several TCP corpora, each of which has a different selection of texts. This corpus contains 8,002,431 words in 1,796 texts.

TCP3.description: Currently displayed: a subset of texts from the Text Creation Partnership that contains approximately the same number of words as the full Women Writers Online corpus, to allow for experimental comparisons between the two corpora. This is one of several TCP corpora, each of which has a different selection of texts. This corpus contains 7,990,878 words in 470 texts.

TCP4.description: Currently displayed: a subset of texts from the Text Creation Partnership that contains approximately the same number of words as the full Women Writers Online corpus, to allow for experimental comparisons between the two corpora. This is one of several TCP corpora, each of which has a different selection of texts. This corpus contains 8,343,987 words in 69 texts.

VWWP.shortDescription: The Victorian Women Writers Project Corpus
VWWP.description: Currently displayed: the entire Victorian Women Writers Project corpus of women's writing from 1830 to 1929. This corpus contains 8,065,805 words in 199 texts.

VWWP and 19thc WWO.shortDescription: The Victorian Women Writers Project and 19thC Women Writers Online Combined Corpus
VWWP and 19thc WWO.description: Currently displayed: a combined corpus that includes the full set of Victorian Women Writers Projects texts and the subset of the Women Writers Online corpus that was published in the 19th century. This corpus contains 11,625,245 words in 295 texts.

WWO 17th century.description: Currently displayed: a subset of the Women Writers Online corpus that includes texts that were published in the 16th and 17th centuries. Because this model is trained on a small corpus, it should be treated as experimental. This corpus contains 3,886,257 words in 201 texts.

WWO 18th century.description: Currently displayed: a subset of the Women Writers Online corpus that includes texts that were published in the 18th century. Because this model is trained on a small corpus, it should be treated as experimental. This corpus contains 3,408,243 words in 119 texts.

WWO 19th Century.description: Currently displayed: a subset of the Women Writers Online corpus that includes texts that were published in the 19th century. Because this model is trained on a small corpus, it should be treated as experimental. This corpus contains 3,559,440 words in 96 texts.

WWO Body Content.shortDescription: Text content extracted from the <body> element in the WWO, excludes front and back matter
WWO Body Content.description: Currently displayed: a subset of the Women Writers Online corpus that includes the body of each text, without front or back matter. This corpus contains 10,669,922 words in 405 texts.

WWO Verse.shortDescription: Poetry and verse subset of the WWO
WWO Verse.description: Currently displayed: a subset of the Women Writers Online corpus that includes all text marked as appearing in a verse line group (<lg>). Because this model is trained on a small corpus, it should be treated as experimental. This corpus contains 4,973,946 words in 290 texts.

WWO Prose.shortDescription: Prose only subset of the WWO
WWO Prose.description:
Currently displayed: a subset of the Women Writers Online corpus that includes all text marked as appearing in a paragraph (

). This corpus contains 8,433,255 words in 406 texts.

EEBO-archive.description: This subset of texts from Early English Books Online contains approximately the same number of words as the full Women Writers Online corpus, to allow for experimental comparisons between the two corpora. This is the first of several EEBO corpora that will be included in the Word Vector Interface.

VWWP Morphadorned.shortDescription: Morphadorned Victorian Women Writers Project Corpus
VWWP Morphadorned.description: We have parsed the TEI of the VWWP and extracted its body content. It has been further regularized with Morphadorner.

WWO Global Publications.shortDescription: Texts published outside the U.S. in the WWO
WWO Global Publications.description: Texts published outside the U.S. Texts have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus.

WWO U.S. Publications.description: Only texts published in the United States. Texts have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus.

eme-Morphed WWO 17th Century.shortDescription: Morphadorned (eme) WWO texts from the 17th century
eme-Morphed WWO 17th Century.description: This subset of the WWO corpus includes texts that appear in the 16th and 17th century. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with an Early Modern English variant of Morphadorner.

eme-Morphed WWO 18th Century.shortDescription: Morphadorned (eme) WWO texts from the 18th century
eme-Morphed WWO 18th Century.description: This subset of the WWO corpus includes texts that appear in the 18th century. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with an Early Modern English variant of Morphadorner.

eme-Morphed WWO 19th Century.shortDescription: Morphadorned (eme) WWO texts from the 19th century
eme-Morphed WWO 19th Century.description: This subset of the WWO corpus includes texts that appear in the 19th century. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with an Early Modern English variant of Morphadorner.

eme-Morphed WWO Corpus.shortDescription: All Morphadorned (eme) texts from the WWO
eme-Morphed WWO Corpus.description: This is the entire corpus of the WWO. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with an Early Modern English variant of Morphadorner.

eme-Morphed WWO Body Content.shortDescription: Text content extracted from the <body> element in the WWO and Morphadorned (eme), excludes front and back matter
eme-Morphed WWO Body Content.description: This includes text content from the <body> element in the WWO. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with an Early Modern English variant of Morphadorner.

eme-Morphed WWO Verse.shortDescription: Morphadorned (eme) poetry and verse subset of the WWO
eme-Morphed WWO Verse.description: Text content extracted from the <lg> element (line group) of the WWO. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with an Early Modern English variant of Morphadorner.

eme-Morphed WWO Prose.shortDescription: Morphadorned (eme) prose only subset of the WWO
eme-Morphed WWO Prose.description:
Text content extracted from the

element (paragraph) of the WWO. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with an Early Modern English variant of Morphadorner.

eme-Morphed WWO Global Publications.shortDescription: Morphadorned (eme) texts published outside the U.S. in the WWO
eme-Morphed WWO Global Publications.description: Texts published outside the U.S. Texts have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with an Early Modern English variant of Morphadorner.

eme-Morphed WWO U.S. Publications.shortDescription: Morphadorned (eme) U.S. publications in the WWO
eme-Morphed WWO U.S. Publications.description: Only texts published in the United States. Texts have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with an Early Modern English variant of Morphadorner.

Morphadorned WWO 17th Century.shortDescription: Morphadorned WWO texts from the 17th century
Morphadorned WWO 17th Century.description: This subset of the WWO corpus includes texts that appear in the 16th and 17th century. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with Morphadorner.

Morphadorned WWO 18th Century.shortDescription: Morphadorned WWO texts from the 18th century
Morphadorned WWO 18th Century.description: This subset of the WWO corpus includes texts that appear in the 18th century. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with Morphadorner.

Morphadorned WWO 19th Century.shortDescription: Morphadorned WWO texts from the 19th century
Morphadorned WWO 19th Century.description: This subset of the WWO corpus includes texts that appear in the 19th century. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with Morphadorner.

Morphadorned WWO Corpus.shortDescription: All Morphadorned texts from the WWO
Morphadorned WWO Corpus.description: This is the entire corpus of the WWO. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with Morphadorner.

Morphadorned WWO Body Content.shortDescription: Text content extracted from the <body> element in the WWO and Morphadorned, excludes front and back matter
Morphadorned WWO Body Content.description: This includes text content from the <body> element in the WWO. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with Morphadorner.

Morphadorned WWO Verse.shortDescription: Morphadorned poetry and verse subset of the WWO
Morphadorned WWO Verse.description: Text content extracted from the <lg> element (line group) of the WWO. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with Morphadorner.

Morphadorned WWO Prose.shortDescription: Morphadorned prose only subset of the WWO
Morphadorned WWO Prose.description:
Text content extracted from the

element (paragraph) of the WWO. They have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with Morphadorner.

Morphadorned WWO Global Publications.shortDescription: Morphadorned texts published outside the U.S. in the WWO
Morphadorned WWO Global Publications.description: Texts published outside the U.S. Texts have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with Morphadorner.

Morphadorned WWO U.S. Publications.shortDescription: Morphadorned U.S. publications in the WWO
Morphadorned WWO U.S. Publications.description: Only texts published in the United States. Texts have been prepared using XSLT and XQuery processes that clean and regularize the corpus. They have been further regularized with Morphadorner.
